Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Great Counting Caper with 3 Blind Mice, The (USA).zip
Game.Notes:
Mother Goose and the 3 blind mice enchant your children into a whirlwind of wacky fun and learning. Join the escapades as your children learn all about the basics of early math. They'll learn how to identify, count and write numbers 1 through 10 while developing logic and reasoning skills through a variety of fun activities. And using characters from the story plus their own original art, your children can create and animate their own cartoons! Practice counting at the Cheese Cafe
Spin and match colors and shapes
Use your imagination when decorating the farmhouse mice
Learn to trace numbers 0 through 9
Explore number identification and weight measurement
Create and animate your own cartoons!
Game.Title: The Great Counting Caper With the 3 Blind Mice

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Ecco Jr. and the Great Ocean Treasure Hunt! (USA).zip
Game.Notes:
Ecco Jr. and the Great Ocean Treasure Hunt!, known as Unou Kaihatsu Series 2 Ecco Jr in Japan, is a video game for the Sega Pico based on the Ecco the Dolphin franchise.
The game is very similar to others in the series, though has an educational theme and is far more simplistic in nature.
Game.Title: Ecco Jr. and the Great Ocean Treasure Hunt!

Game.Notes:
Sonic the Hedgehog's Gameworld is an early childhood educational "storyware" cartridge for the Sega Pico system. The cart is one of two Sonic-related games for the system, the other being Tails and the Music Maker. Gameworld was released in August 1994 in Japan and November 1995 in North America.
Children interact with the game by the use of a "magic pen," the stylus used with the Pico system. After choosing to have either one or two players and an easy or hard difficulty, the game opens up with a simple story—Dr. Robotnik has hidden a Chaos Emerald on each floor of the Gameworld, an amusement park-like tower. Sonic, Tails and Amy must beat all the minigames on each level and find the Emeralds.
To start a game, the child would move the stylus over to an area marking an activity, where an icon would appear showing whether the magic pen, direction pad or red button would be used in the minigame. The scoring of each game is determined by the performance in each task.
Game.Title: Sonic the Hedgehog's Gameworld

After choosing an easy or advanced level, children solve number problems while helping to rescue the puppies from evil Cruella De Vil. Using cute characters from the story and their own original art, your children will create and animate their own cartoon adventures!

Game.Notes: Pepe's Puzzles is a puzzle game created for small children between the ages of 5-7 years old. There are three different kinds of mini-games found in this game; Mazes, Puzzles, and Sequential Memory/Matching Games. There are 5 different mazes to choose from, all with their own gimmicks. The main goal in the maze mini-games is to get to the flag, but each mini-game involves a different way to do so. One is simple movement, one is following arrows, one is a specifically colored path, one involves picking up all the fish food before reaching the flag, and one has X or O spaces on the maze. There are two different puzzles to choose from; a slide puzzle and a jigsaw puzzle. There are bad penguins that should be avoided in both puzzles. There are 4 different matching/memory games to choose from. One is simply matching fish, one is remembering the correct pathways by color, one has you turn the pages of the book to find an object, and one has you match the colored shapes in order. There are 2-3 difficulty levels depending on the mini-game, and it primarily focuses on teaching problem-solving and logic skills.
Game.Title: Pepe's Puzzles

Game.Title: The Berenstain Bears' A School Day

Game.Notes:
Cutey Honey F (also known as Cutie Honey F, Cutie Honey Flash, and Cutey Honey F) is a 1997 video game developed by Bandai for the Sega Pico computer system based on the TV series of the same name.
Sister Jill kidnaps Natsuko to lure out Cutey Honey. Honey investigates Natsuko's disappearance while having to deal with the Panthers stationed around her school and community. By helping her classmates and defeat the Panthers. Honey fights against Jill after tracking her down and wins rescuing Natsuko.
Players control Honey by moving around various areas and interacting with other characters. At certain points, Honey can assume alternate forms to play mini games that advance the plot, most of which involve the Panther grunts and after the games are over, Honey becomes Cutie Honey and finishes them off. Every time one of these minigames are played, Honey loses a heart point and to recover them she interacts with certain NPCs in conversation and going on dates with some of them.
Game.Title: Cutey Honey F

Your children will learn about the calendar, how to tell time and about amazing inventions created by Leonardo Da Vinci, Thomas Edison and the Wright Brothers. Using characters from the story and their own original art, your children will create and animate their own cartons!

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Smart Alex and Smart Alice - Curious Kids (USA).zip
Game.Notes:
Join Smart Alex and Smart Alice on a mission of discovery! From the grocery store to the toy store warehouse, your children will be with Smart Alex and Smart Alice on all of their adventures. They'll learn to count, spell and create lots of Pico pictures. Using characters from the story and their own original art, your children will create their own cartoons! Choose advanced for the early elementary skill level!
Shop for groceries and learn to count your money!
Recognize shapes and put them in their place!
Create a picture with puzzle pieces!
Make shapes big or small to fit them in the box!
Match the letters and learn to spell!
Game.Title: Smart Alex and Smart Alice: Curious Kids

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Lion King, The - Adventures at Pride Rock (USA).zip
Game.Notes: Disney's The Lion King: Adventures at Pride Rock is based on the 1994 Disney animated film. It offers several activities in Simba's universe: Use memory skills to create a picture with puzzle pieces. Uncover a picture and learn your ABC. Match and learn shapes and put them in their place. Count stars in the sky and learn numbers. Develop your dexterity in an easy arcade mini-game
Game.Title: The Lion King: Adventures at Pride Rock

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Mickey no Tokyo Disneyland Stamp Rally (Japan) (Rev A).zip
Game.Title: Mickey no Tokyo Disneyland Stamp Rally

Game.Notes: Disney's Pocahontas Riverbend Adventure is described as storyware and it based on the 1995 animated Disney film. It offers several activities in the universe of the Indian princess: Music: create your own tunes to make Pocahontas dance. Geometry: create pottery using different shapes. Coordination: a little arcade game with a canoe on the river, Pocahotas should doge objects. Pairing: find different clothes to recreate Percy's suits. Drawing/count: use the pico pen to link numbered dots to reveal a picture.
Game.Title: Disney's Pocahontas: Riverbend Adventures
Soreike! Anpanman: Anpanman to Suuji Asobi

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Richard Scarry's Huckle and Lowly's Busiest Day Ever (USA).zip
Game.Notes: Based on the characters created by famous author and illustrator Richard Scarry (BusyTown, Busy World), this educational game intends to develop memory (a pairing game) and creativity (with cookies customisation), learn colors and mixing them to create new ones, or find a path to move a character to a destination, avoiding obstacles. A basic animation studio kit allows children to create a short cartoon.
Game.Title: Richard Scarry's Huckle and Lowly's Busiest Day Ever

Game.Notes:
Donald no Obake Taiji (ドナルドのおばけたいじ) is a Sega Pico game based on the Donald Duck franchise.
Though only released in Japan, plans were put in place at one stage to bring the game to Germany as Donalds Gespensterjagd. A prototype German ROM has since been released, and hints that it was due for release in 1995.
Game.Title: Donald no Obake Taiji

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Oshare Pico - Suteki ni Henshin! Runa-chan no Oshare Hair Salon (Japan).zip
Game.Notes: Oshare Pico: Suteki ni Henshin! Runa-chan no Oshare Hair Salon (おしゃれピコ すてきにへんしん！ るなちゃんのおしゃれヘアサロン) is a Sega Pico educational game by Sega Toys released in September of 2000. The game had several packages, two of which came with a dolly and hair salon playset.
Game.Title: Oshare Pico - Suteki ni Henshin! Runa-chan no Oshare Hair Salon

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Tottoko Hamtarou Tottoko Tanoshiku Aiueo - Maboroshi no Hikaru Tane o Mitsukeru no dah! (Japan).zip
Game.Title: Tottoko Hamtarou Tottoko Tanoshiku Aiueo: Maboroshin o Hikaru Tane o Mitsukeru no Dah!
Doubutsu Pico Hamster Land ~Shokai Gentei-Hamster Ningyou Fuzoku~

Game.Notes: Magic Crayons intends to help the children to learn basic geometrical figures, colors and dexterity while coloring black&white scenes with the sensitive pen of the Pico system, placing geometrical forms, creating toys from different parts (choosing body, ears, eyes, etc...). A basic animation studio kit allows kids to create short cartoons.
Game.Title: Magic Crayons

Game.Notes: Gekisou Sentai Carranger (激走戦隊カーレンジャー) is a Sega Pico game based on the Gekisou Sentai Carranger television show.
Game.Title: Gekisou Sentai Carranger

Game.Notes: Disney Princesses: Ariel is a Miscellaneous game, developed and published by Sega Toys, which was released in Japan in 2004.
Game.Title: Disney Princess: Ariel
Fishing Pico: Donald no Adventure Fishing

Game.Notes: Magic Knight Rayearth: Magic Knight Tanjou is an educational game for the Sega Pico based on the Magic Knight Rayearth anime.
Game.Title: Magic Knight Rayearth: Magic Knight Tanjou

Game.Notes: A Nintendo franchise has come to a SEGA console. Pocket Monsters: Sūji o Tsukamaeyou! is an educational game for younger players, based directly on the Pokémon anime series. Taking place late in the Johto saga, Ash Ketchum (or here, Satoshi) is traveling with Misty (Kasumi) and Brock (Takeshi). As usual, Team Rocket is following, and they attack, stealing all their Pokémon except for Pikachu and Togepi. The player must recover the lost Pokémon through a series of minigames, most of them math related. The game features voice acting from the anime's cast.
Game.Title: Pocket Monsters: Sūji o Tsukamaeyou!

Game.Notes: Ultra Hero is an Ultraman-themed game for the Sega Pico.
Game.Title: Ultra Hero

Game.Title: Keyboard Pico 2: Sawattemiyou! Yoiko no Hajimete Keyboard

Game.Notes: Tails, the double-tailed fox, takes children in a musical trip : they will discover many instruments, the basics of rhythm and tempo. An animated keyboard lets them play their own tracks, an special pinball shows the different percussion sounds. A basic editor using Sonic universe characters would even let them create their own cartoons, dubbed by their musical creation.
Game.Title: Tails and the Music Maker

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Professeur PICO et la Machine a Couleurs (France).zip
Game.Title: Professeur PICO et la Machine a Couleurs

Game.Notes:
LEGO Fun to Build is a puzzle game title where each of the levels are based on LEGO themes of the time, including Town, Aquazone, Castle, and Space . The game also features a free build mode in which the player can use common LEGO pieces to build their own model, as well as draw on a snapshot of the completed project.
The building puzzles show an order of steps to follow to complete building different LEGO models. The order is demonstrated opposite of how it should be assembled, and the player must choose among the 6 parts which to add next to complete the model. A score will be shown for how many seconds it took to build the model. The lower the score, the better the record.
Most of the building puzzles are followed by minigames, ranging from racing to hockey.
Game.Title: LEGO Fun to Build

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\NHK Okaasan to Issho - Goo Choco Lantan - Minna de Oekaki! - Tanoshii Asobi mo Ippai! (Japan).zip

Game.Notes: Hello Kitty no Suteki na o-Tanjoubi (ハローキティのすてきなおたんじょうび) is a single player educational action game. Today is Hello Kitty’s birthday. In each scene, there are multiple arcade-style mini-games, which must be played (mostly within a time limit) to progress the story. Some games make use of the control pad to play, while others utilize the stylus. The player is also free to interact with the scenery and characters in between mini-games.
Game.Title: Hello Kitty no Suteki na o-Tanjoubi

Game.Notes: Donald no TV Show (ドナルドのテレビショー) is a Sega Pico game released exclusively in Japan.

Game.ApplicationPath: R:\ROMS-1G1R\erista-nointro-sega-pico\Pocket Monsters Advance Generation - Hiragana Katakana Kakechatta! (Japan).zip
Game.Notes: Pocket Monsters Advanced Generation: Hiragana Katakana Kakechatta! is an educational Pokémon game for SEGA Pico. It is designed with the purpose of teaching Japanese children to write in both hiragana and katakana. Team Rocket disguise themselves to trick Ash, Brock, May, and Max into catching more Pokémon. Pokémon are caught by correctly drawing Japanese symbols. The player is shown a symbol being drawn, then they must trace the character over a template on the screen using the Pico's pen controller. Pokémon are caught for every five kana.
Game.Title: Pocket Monsters Advance Generation Hiragana! Katakana! Kakechatta!

Game.Notes: Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon S is an educational game, developed and published by Bandai, which was released in 1995.
